column3: Trump to Tap New Company to Make Covid-19 Drugs in the U.S. The Trump administration on Tuesday will announce one of the largest-ever contracts to bring pharmaceutical manufacturing from abroad to a new plant in Virginia. The Trump administration will announce on Tuesday that it has signed a $354 million four-year contract with a new company in Richmond, Va., to manufacture generic medicines and pharmaceutical ingredients that are needed to treat Covid-19 but are now made overseas, mostly in India and China.

Trump to Tap New Company to Make Covid-19 Drugs in the U.S. President Trump said in a tweet Thursday that he would nominate a new company to manufacture the high-priced hepatitis C drug Citalopram in the U.S. The drug is usually manufactured in India, and it's been at the center of a bitter public-relations battle over the cost of the drug and the profit margin that the drugmaker has profited from. Pfizer, the company that owns the drug, has accused the Indian government of using its patent on the drug to maintain price increases that the company saysPresident Trump said in a tweet Thursday that he would nominate a new company to manufacture the high-priced hepatitis C drug Citalopram in the U.S. The drug is usually manufactured in India, and it's been at the center of a bitter public-relations battle over the cost of the drug and the profit margin that the drugmaker has profited from. U.S.-China Feud Over Coronavirus Erupts at World Health Assembly China’s president pledged $2 billion to fight the virus, a move the United States criticized as an effort to head off scrutiny of its handling of the pandemic.

U.S.-China Feud Over Coronavirus Erupts at World Health Assembly. The U.S. reported a sixfold increase in its use of experimental antivirals in the wake of the disease, and "some flu" patients are being treated with drugs made from pig cells. The drugs have been traced to pigs, which were apparently also used to grow the flu viruses. The growing political fallout from the outbreak could contribute to American voter dissatisfaction with Washington's response to the crisis, observers say. Barr Dismisses Trump’s Claim That Russia Inquiry Was an Obama Plot.The attorney general said that an investigation into the Russia inquiry was focusing on others, not the former president.

Barr Dismisses Trump’s Claim That Russia Inquiry Was an Obama Plot. The attorney general said that an investigation by Special Counsel Robert Mueller is not tied to his decision to fire former FBI director James Comey. (Published Wednesday, May 18, 2017). White House Deputy Press Secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders says Trump called Rosenstein, who appointed Mueller special counsel in May, for a personal conversation Wednesday morning, when the president asked Rosenstein whether he could intervene on behalf of Comey, according to a statement from the White House. Sanders said the president did not disclose that the conversation happened during a larger conversation that included "the attorney general and deputy attorney general.". The president then went to the Oval Office and had a lengthy conversation with Comey, who later provided a.

Inspector General’s Firing Puts Pompeo’s Use of Taxpayer Funds Under Scrutiny. Accusations of improperly using government resources have trailed the secretary of state, but President Trump’s move to fire the State Department inspector general has handed Democrats a new weapon

Inspector General’s Firing Puts Pompeo’s Use of Taxpayer Funds Under Scrutiny. At least 20 Senate Democrats and nearly a dozen House Democrats are vowing to mount a filibuster to block a nominee who did not comply with federal ethics guidelines and failed to cooperate fully with the State Department inspector general. The Democrats said they will ask for additional information, but will stop short of promising an outright refusal to approve Pompeo. They are eager to steer the incoming Trump administration toward an agenda centered around criminal justice and national security and will need support
